channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [QPID-615] ImmediateMessageTest Hang
item.description:
I've seen this test hang twice now on the M2.1 branch. This the stack trace from the hang. It appears to be waiting for a frame which I would expect to timeout. Thing is it doesn't timeout.

Running org.apache.qpid.server.exchange.ImmediateMessageTest
Full thread dump Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.5.0_08-b03 mixed mode, sharing):

"VmPipeIdleStatusChecker" daemon prio=6 tid=0x0320afb8 nid=0xec0 waiting on condition [0x0330f000..0x0330fb68]

at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)

.java:74)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I have run this tests thousands of times and not been able to repoduce this error. Instead, I sometimes get a live lock on IdentityHashMap.

It look like there might be a bug in IdentityHashMap, because the put method does not check that the map is full before attempting a put. If the map were full, it would loop forever, which is what appears to be happening. At the end of the put method, if the map is nearly full, is resized, so it is not clear how this might happen. The iterator remove method, comes under suspicion.

After doing a clean re-build on 1.6:

2007-09-28 15:44:23
Full thread dump Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (1.6.0-b105 mixed mode):

A patched version of the VmPipe cleanup thread has been added, so that the tests avoid the calls to IdentityHashMap through MINA code.

Un upgrade to a newer version of MINA will be needed, once one is available.

Upgrade to MINA 1.0.7, ETA mid-October.
